fields.description:
Currently a number of users using LDAP or crowd are getting

{noformat}
2010-03-25 07:55:29,954 WARN [http-8084-3] [atlassian.confluence.util.ReadOnlyLicenseCalculator] getNumberOfLicensedUsers Licensing calculation took more than 2000 ms
 -- referer: https://HOST/pages/editpage.action?pageId=1769639 | url: /pages/doeditpage.action | userName: userName | action: doeditpage | page: 1769639
2010-03-25 09:51:43,272 WARN [http-8084-6] [atlassian.confluence.util.ReadOnlyLicenseCalculator] getNumberOfLicensedUsers Licensing calculation took more than 2000 ms
 -- url: /pages/doeditpage.action | page: 6389881 | userName: userName | referer: https://HOST/pages/editpage.action?pageId=6389881 | action: doeditpage
{noformat}

As our getNumberOfLicensedUsers needs to get every user in every group that has can use permission in order to determine the license count. 
This can create a large load on the LDAP server which causes it to slow and hence hit the timeout. 

We should look to improving the logic, so we can count the users more efficiently. 

If we could remove the need to get each user, then we could potentially resolve [CONF-18723|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-18723]
fields.summary: Improve getNumberOfLicensedUsers so that it does not need to fetch every user in order to count the number of licensed users.

fields.description:
After importing a Word document with footnotes into Confluence, the footnotes disappear in the wiki markup. There is no sign of \{footnotes} at all.

*This is against what we advertise on our [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Office+Connector]*:

{quote}
|| Option	 || Default Value	|| Description ||
| Advanced Formatting Options Use the footnote macro for Word footnotes	 | Disabled	| If this option is enabled, a Confluence page created from an imported Word document will use the \{footnote\} macro from Adaptavist to render any footnotes contained in the document. Note that you will need to install the Footnotes Plugin onto your Confluence site. For more information about this plugin and macro, please refer to the [Footnotes Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Footnotes+Plugin]. |
{quote}

The [^testfile.doc] is a sample for reproducing this problem
fields.summary: Word footnotes import in Doc Import is broken

Fortunately James Roper has [created a fix in plugin version 3.3|http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/changelog/public/atlassian/studio/activity-stream/trunk/streams-confluence-plugin/src?cs=38109], please include this version in Confluence.

fields.description:
The following, copied right from the Notation Guide, does not work:

I have verified this problem both in Conf. 3.1.1 and 2.10.1.

When testing an upgrade, customer was getting NPE being thrown on the dashboard, with the following stack traces as the cause:

{noformat}
2010-03-24 19:26:58,469 ERROR [http-9823-1] [atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager] getAttachmentData Could not find data for attachment: Attachment: Options.GIF v.1 (92241928) nwilkins - java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/user/confluence/data/attachments/ver003/177/12/262177/134/78/92078134/92241928 (No such file or directory)
...
2010-03-24 19:26:58,473 ERROR [http-9823-1] [renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent] processMacro Unexpected error formatting macro: recently-updated-dashboard
 -- referer: http://HOST:PORT/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /dashboard.action | userName: admin | action: dashboard
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.core.util.ImageInfo.read(ImageInfo.java:1228)
	at com.atlassian.core.util.ImageInfo.check(ImageInfo.java:249)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsManager.buildImageDetails(DefaultImageDetailsManager.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsManager.createImageDetails(DefaultImageDetailsManager.java:56)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsManager.getImageDetails(DefaultImageDetailsManager.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.getThumbnailInfo(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.getThumbnailInfo(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.DefaultThumbnailInfoFactory.getThumbnailInfo(DefaultThumbnailInfoFactory.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.dashboard.RecentlyUpdatedContentMacro.addThumbnailData(RecentlyUpdatedContentMacro.java:406)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.dashboard.RecentlyUpdatedContentMacro.getChangeSets(RecentlyUpdatedContentMacro.java:357)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.dashboard.RecentlyUpdatedContentMacro.execute(RecentlyUpdatedContentMacro.java:303)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.ContentFilteringMacro.execute(ContentFilteringMacro.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.execute(ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.executeMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.processMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.makeMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.WikiContentRendererHandler.handleMacro(WikiContentRendererHandler.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.WikiMarkupParser.makeMacro(WikiMarkupParser.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.WikiMarkupParser.handlePotentialMacro(WikiMarkupParser.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.WikiMarkupParser.parse(WikiMarkupParser.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.render(MacroRendererComponent.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.V2Renderer.render(V2Renderer.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.plugin.PluggableV2Renderer.render(PluggableV2Renderer.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.V2RendererFacade.convertWikiToXHtml(V2RendererFacade.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
...
{noformat}

The NPE is being thrown because the DefaultAttachmentManager cannot find the attachment in the getAttachmentData(Attachment) method. 

This is most likely because when copying the {{<CONFLUENCE_HOME>}} and the database over from production to test on the test server, they were copied over from a live instance and are slightly out of sync, hence the attachment does not exist in the home directory though it does in the database. 

Point of the story is, we shouldn't be throwing NPEs :)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19151].
  {panel}

Very useful would be to have the possibility to define metadata key/value pair OUTSIDE wiki content, in order
- to protect them
- to be outside content (they are data about data)
- enable more formal location of metadata
- this formalism would enable more structured and predictable enforcement on:
1. force user to compile metadata
2. auto compile metadata
3. allow remote API to quick fetch metadata programmatically

thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19139].
  {panel}

All Confluence administrators need a way to identify the additional plugins not included in the original Confluence distribution but uploaded at a later time.

Currently I check the confluence-home/plugins-cache directory to accomplish this (sort of), Some files have the plugin name in the file name, but files uploaded by the Plugin Manager haven't.

{noformat}
-rw-r--r-- 1 tomcat tomcat   53400 Mar 24 19:17 1269454669368tagcumulus.jar
-rw-r--r-- 1 tomcat tomcat   12175 Mar 24 19:17 1269454669371downloadedPlugin.1obPbE6EIkbrp7BMekhf.16976.jar
-rw-r--r-- 1 tomcat tomcat    6678 Mar 24 19:17 1269454669545sitemap-0.2.jar
-rw-r--r-- 1 tomcat tomcat 1464532 Mar 24 19:17 1269454669565googleanalytics-1.1.jar

-rw-r--r-- 1 tomcat tomcat  121888 Mar 25 09:00 1269504021529graphviz-plugin-1.2.0.jar

Suggestion:

- add the plugin name also to the files uploaded by the Plugin Manager. This should be a rather trivial modification but it would be very useful.

- add a "non-Atlassian plugin" section or flag column in the plugin list in the "System Information" and/or Support Utility page

fields.description:
[MySQL documentation|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/connector-j-reference-configuration-properties.html] discourage using the autoReconnect parameter:

bq. The use of this feature is not recommended, because it has side effects related to session state and data consistency when applications don't handle SQLExceptions properly, and is only designed to be used when you are unable to configure your application to handle SQLExceptions resulting from dead and stale connections properly. Alternatively, investigate setting the MySQL server variable "wait_timeout" to some high value rather than the default of 8 hours.

However we make this parameter set to true by default upon installation of Confluence.

In JIRA, this parameter has been dropped and deemed useless: JRA-15731

If this also applies to Confluence, we should also do the same and update our documentation.
fields.summary: Should we drop MySQL's  autoReconnect=true from Confluence?

fields.description:
h5. Bug Background

When using Rich Text Editor in Confluence 3.2, page title with exclamation mark cannot be linked to. This affects both the keyboard shortcut(by using the [ character) and also the link icon in Rich Text Editor. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page with exclamation mark. For example. Test!
# Create another page and enter the following as the contents:
{code}
[
{code}
# The keyboard shortcut will trigger the link function and provides a set of page titles which includes the Test! page
# Select Test! as the page for the link
# Save the page
# The link will not be generated as a valid link. Instead it will be shown as the following:
{code}
[Test\!|TSP:Test!]
{code}
# When you edit the page again, the following will be displayed in Rich Text Mode:
{code}
Test!|TSP:Test!
{code}
# Round-triping between Rich Text and Wiki Markup editor causes the situation to be worse
# The following screenshots illustrates the bug:
#* [^Step1.jpg]
#* [^Step2.jpg]
#* [^Step3.jpg]
#* [^Step4.jpg]
#* [^Step5.jpg]
#* [^Step6.jpg]

h5. Workaround
Use Wiki Markup to enter the link:
{code}
[Test!]
{code}
fields.summary: Page title with exclamation mark cannot be linked in Rich Text Editor
Create a separate permission to allow attaching attachments in a page with restricted edit permission

fields.description:
Recently Updated or Recently Update Dashboard will display Blog updates even though Space Admin permissions are set to No access to Add or Remove blog.  And the Space Home page is also set to View Restrictions.  This seems to be a bug that would allow access to blogs when you are trying to lock them down.

Ideally, Atlassian should consider applying the Page View & Edit Restriction concept to blogs.  Similar to CONF-5332 issue, you should be able to set access to certain blogs only.  For instance, I have a HR space. We blog all our corporate events and important HR news. However,my HR team cannot post anything that they don't want everyone in the company to see.  

Even if we live within the current security model, we still have the bug with Recent Update list that allow non-approved users access to blog postings.

I listed as major since any security/permission bug could be very costly to a company.
fields.summary: Recently Updated - Shows Blogs when it should not

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19126].
  {panel}

Hi,

in our Wiki, users often use arrows in the text. Confluence does not have built-in arrows, so they just use {{-->}} which is displayed as -->, but these "fake" arrows look really bad.

Therefore, it would be great if Confluence had a feature to convert these "fake" arrows into real arrow symbols. Confluence already does something similar with dashed where {{\-\-}} and {{\-\-\-}} is converted into the real dashes.

As a workaround, I created a user macro {{\{rarr\}}} that creates the HTML entity {{→}}, but it is not very intuitive for users to use {{\{rarr\}}} instead of {{-->}}.

I really hope that a feature like this could be added to Confluence because it would be a nice improvement for "every day usability". :-)
fields.summary: Add shortcuts for arrow symbols

fields.description:
Confluence will throw a NullPointerException below when it receives a Null value instead of a Group / User name when checking for Group / User permission.
{noformat}
2010-03-24 16:11:01,478 ERROR [http-8080-6] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /pages/getpagepermissions.action | userName: clan | referer: http://localhost:8080/display/permission/Clan%27s+restricted+page
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.PermittedUserFinder.checkGroupExplicitlyPermitted(PermittedUserFinder.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.PermittedUserFinder.makeResult(PermittedUserFinder.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction.execute(GetPagePermissionsAction.java:84)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.java:35)
{noformat}

This can happen when an LDAP group / User was given a permission (eg. view, edit) in Confluence and then was deleted from the LDAP server.

This problem will cause the specific user who created the permission in the first place to not able adding anymore permission to the space. 

Clicking on padlock or trying to edit Restrictions will result in the stack trace above in the log file. 

No error is visible from the browser.

h4. Workaround

If you hit into this bug and not sure which group to remove from the permission list, the attached patch will help you to identify which groups are causing the problem.

*To install:*
# Unzip the [zip file|^pages.zip] into {{<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence}}
The patch {{GetPagePermissionsAction.class}} should reside at {{<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\pages\actions\}}. If you don't have {{\pages\actions\}} directories under {{<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence}}, create them.
# Add an extra line in *<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\log4j.properties* file:
{code}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction=DEBUG
{code}
# Restart Confluence

*To use the patch:*
# Visit the problematic page
# Click on padlock
# Check <confluence data>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log for something like below:
{noformat}
010-03-25 11:23:13,212 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group1. Fetched result is: null
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: confluence-administrators. Fetched result is: confluence-administrators
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group2. Fetched result is: ldap-group2
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group3. Fetched result is: ldap-group3
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group4. Fetched result is: null
{noformat}

In the above there are two LDAP groups that no longer exist (ldap-group1 and ldap-group4) and the Fetched result is null.

For each of the identified groups, please remove by visiting {{Space Admin > Security > Restricted Pages}}. Click on the padlock icon for the problematic page, this will take you to a page info view where you can remove individual permissions.

Use the same step above if you want to remove permissions for Null user objects.

The patch will print similar information like above for user names:
{noformat}
2010-04-01 11:32:31,250 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching user object for user name: clan. Fetched result is: clan
2010-04-01 11:32:31,265 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching user object for user name: roy. Fetched result is: roy
2010-04-01 11:32:31,265 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching user object for user name: bambang. Fetched result is: null
{noformat}
fields.summary: Encountered NullPointerException due to dangling permission left after an LDAP group or user is deleted from the LDAP server

PDF previewer in web pages isn't production ready.
Everyone can tell it, do you have just tried to view a PDF with it?

I would suggest Confluence team to use the open source components shipped with Alfresco Share, it is very good and zoomable.

Just look at the difference in rendering compared to Confluence (screenshots)

fields.description:
h5. Bug Background

Searching for users with an empty value in the text-field returns the Add User form instead. Here are the screenshots:
* Initial search without value: [^FindUser.png]
* Result of clicking the Search button: [^AddUser.png]

h5. Findings 

# In Confluence 2.10 and below, the following error is displayed, which should be the expected behaviour
{code}
The following error(s) occurred:

    * You must specify a search term.
{code}
# Here is the screenshot of the above:
#* [^CorrectError.png]
# The problem started since Confluence 2.10.
fields.summary: Searching for users with empty value returns add user form

fields.description:
I'm pretty sure that in 3.1, when you opened the image dialog, it focused the "Align" dropdown, so you could shift-tab back to the dialog tabs to change the active one with the keyboard.

This doesn't seem to work any more in 3.2. The focus doesn't seem to be anywhere within the dialog, so hitting tab or shift tab either jumps around the page or the browser chrome.
fields.summary: Keyboard navigation in image dialog broken

fields.description: Detail the database changes made during upgrades for customers who wish to manage their db more closely
fields.summary: Document changes to database for upgrades

fields.description:
In the rare situation where a macro has multiple un-named parameters, a slightly different parameter map is generated between Rich Text and Wiki Markup.

See macro-browser.js in conf-webapp, particularly the functions getSelectedMacro and parseMacro.  

getSelectedMacro is invoked by the wiki markup editor, and this internally calls parseMacro. The Rich Text Editor calls parseMacro directly.

The problem occurs because getSelectedMacro clears out the macro parameters parsed by parseMacro and re-creates the parameter list again from scratch, using a slightly different algorithm.  

We think that the correct approach is to move the parameter parsing in getSelectedMacro into parseMacro, replacing its method.
fields.summary: Macro Browser parses parameters differently in Rich Text compared to Wiki Markup

fields.description:
We use the {contentbylabel} macro a lot for generating various lists.
However, if no results are shown, it would be a big benefit to have the 'no content found' text configurable. 
Now, it makes the reports hard to use.
fields.summary: Enhance the {contentbylabel} macro so that the text 'No content found for label' can be passed via an argument.

fields.summary: Problems with attachment's size = 0.

fields.description:
After ugrading from 3.1.0 to 3.1.2, the start page of confluence reported that an error happened during the upgrade and that the system logs should be consulted.
There were no errors reported in the catalina.out log at all.

The only hint that an upgrade is being performed were some SQL statements in the log:
{code}
....
2010-03-22 10:21:39,025 INFO [main] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] init Initialising the plugin system
2010-03-22 10:21:39,257 INFO [main] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] init Plugin system started in 0:00:00.229
config location: file:/home/jira/confluence-3.1.2/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/crowd-ehcache.xml
alter table LINKS add constraint FK45157998DD41734 foreign key (CONTENTID) references CONTENT (CONTENTID)
alter table CONTENT_PERM_SET add constraint FKBF45A7992CAF22C1 foreign key (CONTENT_ID) references CONTENT (CONTENTID)
alter table IMAGEDETAILS add constraint FKA768048734A4917E foreign key (ATTACHMENTID) references ATTACHMENTS (ATTACHMENTID)
alter table external_members add constraint FKD8C8D8A5117D5FDA foreign key (groupid) references groups (id)
alter table SPACEPERMISSIONS add constraint FKD33F23BEB2DC6081 foreign key (SPACEID) references SPACES (SPACEID)
create index sp_comp_idx on SPACEPERMISSIONS (PERMTYPE, PERMGROUPNAME, PERMUSERNAME)
2010-03-22 10:22:00,038 main INFO [util.persistence.hibernate.ConfigurableLocalSessionFactoryBean] Building new Hibernate SessionFactory
2010-03-22 10:22:00,110 main INFO [mchange.v2.log.MLog] MLog clients using log4j logging.
....
{code}
After replaying these statements manually on the mysql command prompt, I found out that I ran into this issue, because my tables have been MyISAM:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=192872609

The last "alter table" statement gave me a MySQL error "ERROR 1071 (42000): Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes".

The upgrade worked after converting my tables to InnoDB as described in the page above.

There should definitively be an error message in the logs that explains what has been going wrong during an update - in this case during the DB update.
fields.summary: DB-upgrade from 3.1 to 3.1.2 fails, without error message in the logs

Manage users options are available when viewing LDAP Groups

Steps to Replicate

# Go to Administration Console >> Security >> Manage Groups

It will display an error page containing the error bellow:

fields.description:
We have a problem with RPC plugins that use Confluence API on newer versions of Confluence. The plugins were made as instructed on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/RPC+Module by using a delegator Spring bean wrapped in a transaction to do all the actual work. The plugins worked on earlier versions of Confluence (2.9.x).

When uploading the plugin there is an error creating the Spring bean. I have attached stack traces of the error from Confluence 2.10.4 and 3.1.2. The errors are from one plugin but we have other plugins which generate the same kind of error where the Spring container can't find the proxyInterface class for the Spring bean.

What should be done to get the plugins to work on newer versions of Confluence?
fields.summary: Problem with RPC plugins that use the Confluence API in Confluence 2.10+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19090].
  {panel}

The developer docs for creating a language pack are out of date and scattered all over the place. They need to be cleaned up and pulled together into a cohesive guide.

Existing docs:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Language+Module
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Updating+A+Confluence+Translation
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Translations+for+the+Rich+Text+Editor
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Translations+for+Confluence+Releases
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Confluence+3.2+Translations
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Language+Pack+Translations

Tasks:
* Create a single 'Creating a Language Pack' doc
(i) Properties are not all implemented in ConfluenceActionSupport_KEY.properties anymore (although it can be done this way), rather each bundled plugin has it's own properties file now that is referenced as a resource in the atlassian-plugin.xml, e.g. 'tinymce_fr_FR.properties'
(i) The recommended process for creating a language pack should be to take an existing language pack, update it with their own translations and repackage it. Unfortunately there is no existing English language pack, so it may be difficult to determine what each of the key-value properties relates to. The only way to figure this out is by downloading the plugin (e.g. TinyMCE plugin) and checking the i18n property file or by trial and error (e.g. sticking values in the key and seeing what changes). 
(i) Even better would be to update the example language pack (en_AU.zip) file on the http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation by downloading each of the plugins and copying the data from the properties file of each plugin into the example language pack. Developers could then use this as a base.
=> (!) Use http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Language+Module as the base and merge in content from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation
** Describe structure of the atlassian-plugin.xml file.
(i) dashboard-macros plugin = semi-core functionality, such as 'Recently Updated', macrosadvanced = macro browser, macrofallback = not a plugin, corresponds to macrofallback.properties
** 'Language Pack Overview' section - Remove the blurb 
** 'Language Pack Overview' section - In the table, the ConfluenceActionSupport Properties file only covers the translation of Confluence core. Add text to mention this and add a table entry to cover the i18n.properties files for each of the plugin resources with Confluence, e.g. i18n-tinymce, i18n-linkbrowser, i18n-jiraissues, etc... (see atlassian-plugin.xml in attached french translation for full list)
** 'ConfluenceACtionSupport Properties File' section --- The Java Properties file contains key value pairs for each string in Confluence _Core_ and each string in every plugin...
** From http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation Step 9 --- Replace with Java instructions: 'jar -cvf' (requires JDK)
** From http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation Step 10 --- Can replace with inclusion from 'Installing a Language Pack' doc
=> (!) Deprecate http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation

* Change http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Language+Pack+Translations into a community translations page
=> (!) Remove content on installation of a plugin, however leave the list of community translations.
=> (!) Remove content on developing a language pack. Link to it instead.
=> (!) Remove 'Translations of the Rich Text Editor' section.
NB: Process for submitting a language pack is correct.

* Review http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Translations+for+the+Rich+Text+Editor
The content in this can probably be pulled into the new 'Creating a Language Pack' doc. The instructions are correct, but they are not specific to the RTE. 
=> (!) Cut out intro blurb.
=> (!) Pull content into 'Creating a Language Pack' doc
=> (!) Deprecate?

* Update http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Updating+A+Confluence+Translation
=> (!) Needs investigation. Most likely just delete this page entirely.
fields.summary: Improve Confluence developer docs for Creating a Language Pack
Multiple home directories can be specified in confluence-init.properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19079].
  {panel}

I need to refer to the same attachment (such as image files), from many other pages. At the same time as the wiki evolves the names of pages change frequently, including the names of pages were attachments reside. Also the file names of attachments can change, while the contents is "conceptually" the same (such as new versions of the same document usually has new file names). Currently, every time i change the name of the page that includes the attachment, it breaks the "hard coded" links to attachments everywhere else on the wiki. Also, whenever, i upload a new version of an attachment, i need to make first make sure that it has the file name of the already uploaded file -- although outside of the wiki, this may not be the case anymore. A way to create a symbolic name for a local URL would be most helpful. 

For example:

Instead of: !1.3. Meta models^tmp116.jpg!

It should be possible to indicate the following:

On the 1.3. Meta models page:
{alias meta-models}

On a different page it should then be possible to refer to the attachment as follows:
meta-models^tmp116.jpg


Ideally, when uploading an image it should also be possible to create an alias. For example:

the image tmp116.jpg should have the alias: agent-meta-model

the full link to the attachment should then be:

meta-models^agent-meta-model

Such an approach would allow changing the name of pages and the name of attachments, as they get uploaded, while preserving the functionality of all links to them in the wiki.

If such an alias features is implemented, then one issue to consider is centralized management of alias to URLs/attachments, which could be done instead or in addition to managing of alias within relevant pages.
fields.summary: symbolic name for attachments

Steps to reproduce 

When you create an issue in sac, you get a radio buttons to choose from. I copied the text "Question on how a particular feature or function performs or should be configured." as per the screenshot

!CreateIssue.jpg!

Then I pasted into rich text editor as below

!Paste.jpg!

But when I press space the text disappears. It seems the rich text editor treats it as a label? .

!Space.jpg!

I could reproduce on the [tinyMCE demo site|http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/examples/full.php]. 

Workaround is to switch to wiki markup and paste, or first paste into a text file, then copy and paste that into the rich text editor.

fields.summary: Can't add a user to a group

fields.description: The text that displays in the favpages macro when a user has not yet created any favorites provides the wrong instructions to create favorites. It suggests that a Star icon appears in the upper right, but in wiki pages, the star icon is in the "Tools" drop down menu.  Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Favorites Instructions are wrong; don't reflect that Favorites are a sub-item of Tools menu

fields.description:
The Confluence Documentation still refers to blog posts as news:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ECEC
fields.summary: Update blog documentation to change mentions of news to blog

fields.description:
If you have a code or noformat block in a wiki page that contains blank lines, when you Edit in Word, everything looks normal. When you save back and redisplay, the blank lines now show "\\".  

Whatever is doing the conversion should just leave those lines alone, and not put in \\ for explicit breaks, since that markup doesn't work inside code and noformat.

I'm marking this as major because we have a lot of code in our pages, and we now have to decide whether to disable Edit in Word to keep users from hitting this problem.
fields.summary: Edit in Word function adds // for blank lines inside code and noformat macros, which are then visible in output

fields.description:
I have the following text structure being written in a page:

{color:#003366}{*}Attendees{*}{color}

|| Invitees || Title || Attended? ||
| Person A | | Yes \\ |
| Person A | | Yes \\ |
| Person A | | Yes \\ |
| Person A | | Yes \\ |
| Person A | | Yes |

h2. Notes

* We proceded to go through the charts and discuss issues as they arose. Some of the questions that were asked from the customer were the following:
*# Q: Question Text A
*## lsakjdfla;skjdflaskdjfaslkdfjasl;dkfjasl;kdfjas;ldfj.
*# Q: What are the differnecesldkfjsldkfjslkdfsj? . 
*## Answer yada yeadsefsf.
*# Q: sdfjslkdfjsdlfkjsdflksjdflskfdjs?
*## In hljwkerjwlekrjwle
* This text describes the reason the following table is needed:
|| Item || Resolution ||
| | |
**  



------ END CONTENT OF PAGE --------

When I use the WYSIWYG editor and try entering in the first row of text in the Item/Resolution table, I can fill out the 'Item' column but when I press 'Tab' to go to the next column, the browser crashes.
fields.summary: Safari crashes when editing tables

fields.description:
We got an error trying to disable the User Status plugin.
For our Enterprise wiki based on Confluence we are currently trying to qualify the Confluence 3.1.1 version on a staging environment.
The first goal is to work in the same way as the Confluence 2.10.3 (now installed in production). So in a first time we need to disable all new plugin introduced by the Confleunce 3.x.
Disabling each plugin one after the other, we got the error described in attachment.
Is this plugin mandatory ? Or is there a way to disable the user status plugin?

Regards.
fields.summary: Error trying to disable the User Status plugin
